metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: This page contains a list of practical examples used in real world projects.
content.html: This page contains a list of practical examples used in real world projects.

content.code_html:
// Student data
int studentID = 15;
int studentAge = 23;
float studentFee = 75.25;
char studentGrade = 'B';

// Print variables
 cout << "Student ID: " << studentID << "\n";
cout << "Student Age: " << studentAge << "\n";
cout << "Student Fee: " << studentFee << "\n";
cout << "Student Grade: " << studentGrade << "\n";

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Calculate the area of a rectangle

syntax_highlighting.text: // Calculate the area of a rectangle

content.code_html:
// Create integer variables
int length = 4;
int width = 6;
int area;

// Calculate the area of a rectangle
area = length * width;

// Print the variables
cout << "Length is: " << length << "\n";
cout << "Width is: " << width << "\n";
cout << "Area of the rectangle is: " << area << "\n";

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Calculate the area of a rectangle

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Create variables of different data types

syntax_highlighting.text: // Create variables of different data types

content.code_html:
// Create variables of different data types
int items = 50;
double cost_per_item = 9.99;
double total_cost = items * cost_per_item;
char currency = '$';

// Print variables
cout << "Number of items: " << items << "\n";
cout << "Cost per item: " << cost_per_item << "" << currency << "\n";
cout << "Total cost = " << total_cost << "" << currency << "\n";

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Create variables of different data types

content.text: For a tutorial about conditions in C++, visit our If..Else Chapter .
content.html: For a tutorial about conditions in C++, visit our If..Else Chapter.

content.code_html:
int day = 4;
switch (day) {
  case 1:
    cout << "Monday";
    break;
  case 2:
    cout << "Tuesday";
    break;
  case 3:
    cout << "Wednesday";
    break;
  case 4:
    cout << "Thursday";
    break;
  case 5:
    cout << "Friday";
    break;
  case 6:
    cout << "Saturday";
    break;
  case 7:
    cout << "Sunday";
    break;
}
// Outputs "Thursday" (day 4)

content.text: For a tutorial about switch in C++, visit our Switch Chapter .
content.html: For a tutorial about switch in C++, visit our Switch Chapter.

syntaxHighlighting.text: // A variable with some specific numbers

// A 
  variable to store the reversed number

// Get the last number 
  of 'numbers' and add it to 'revNumbers'

syntax_highlighting.text: // A variable with some specific numbers

// A 
  variable to store the reversed number

// Get the last number 
  of 'numbers' and add it to 'revNumbers'

content.code_html:
// A variable with some specific numbers
int numbers = 12345;

// A variable to store the reversed number
int revNumbers = 0;

// Reverse and reorder the numbers
while (numbers) {
  // Get the last number of 'numbers' and add it to 'revNumbers'
  revNumbers = revNumbers * 10 + numbers % 10;
  // Remove the last number of 'numbers'
  numbers /= 10;
}

cout << "Reversed numbers: " << revNumbers << "\n";

  of 'numbers' and add it to 'revNumbers'

content.code_html:
int dice = 1;

while (dice <= 6) {
  if (dice < 6) {
    cout << "No Yatzy\n";
  } else {
    cout << "Yatzy!\n";
  }
  dice = dice + 1;
}

content.code_html:
int number = 2;
int i;

// Print the multiplication table for the number 2
for (i = 1; i <= 10; i++) {
  cout << number << " x " << i << " = " << number * i << "\n";
}

// Get the length of the 
  array

// Loop through 
  the elements of the array
// Calculate the average by dividing the sum by the length

// Get the length of the 
  array

  the elements of the array
// Calculate the average by dividing the sum by the length

content.code_html:
// An array storing different ages
int ages[8] = {20, 22, 18, 35, 48, 26, 87, 70};

float avg, sum = 0;
int i;

// Get the length of the array
int length = sizeof(ages) / sizeof(ages[0]);

// Loop through the elements of the array
for (int age : ages) {
  sum += age;
}

// Calculate the average by dividing the sum by the length
avg = sum / length;

// Print the average
cout << "The average age is: " << avg << "\n";

content.code_html:
// An array storing different ages
int ages[8] = {20, 22, 18, 35, 48, 26, 87, 70};

int i;

// Get the length of the array
int length = sizeof(ages) / sizeof(ages[0]);

// Create a variable and assign the first array element of ages to it
int lowestAge = ages[0];

// Loop through the elements of the ages array to find the lowest age
for (int age : ages) {
  if (lowestAge > age) {
    lowestAge = age;
  }
}

// Print the lowest age
cout << "The lowest age is: " << lowestAge << "\n";

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Create a car structure and store it in myCar1;
// Create another car structure and store it in myCar2;

syntax_highlighting.text: // Create a car structure and store it in myCar1;
// Create another car structure and store it in myCar2;

content.code_html:
// Declare a structure named "car"
 struct car {
  string brand;
  string model;
  int year;
};

int main() {
  // Create a car structure and store it in myCar1;
   car myCar1;
  myCar1.brand = "BMW";
  myCar1.model = "X5";
  myCar1.year = 1999;

  // Create another car structure and store it in myCar2;
   car myCar2;
  myCar2.brand = "Ford";
  myCar2.model = "Mustang";
  myCar2.year = 1969;
 
  // Print the structure members
   cout << myCar1.brand << " " << myCar1.model << " " << myCar1.year << "\n";
  cout << myCar2.brand << " " << myCar2.model << " " << myCar2.year << "\n";
 
  return 0;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Create a car structure and store it in myCar1;
// Create another car structure and store it in myCar2;

// Function to convert 
  Fahrenheit to Celsius

// Call the 
  function with the fahrenheit value

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Function to convert 
  Fahrenheit to Celsius

// Call the 
  function with the fahrenheit value

content.code_html:
// Function to convert Fahrenheit to Celsius
float toCelsius(float fahrenheit) {
  return (5.0 / 9.0) * (fahrenheit - 32.0);
}

int main() {
  // Set a fahrenheit value
  float f_value = 98.8;

  // Call the function with the fahrenheit value
  float result = toCelsius(f_value);

  // Print the fahrenheit value
  cout << "Fahrenheit: " << f_value << "\n";

  // Print the result
  cout << "Convert Fahrenheit to Celsius: " << result << "\n";

  return 0;
}

content.code_html:
int doubleGame(int x) {
  return x * 2;
}

int main() {
  for (int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) {
    cout << "Double of " << i << " is " << doubleGame(i) << endl;
  }
  return 0;
}
